intro: Selliguea mairei, commonly known as the Maire's rock moss, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a mat-forming plant that typically grows on rocky substrates in humid, shaded environments. The plant has a dense, cushion-like structure with closely packed leaves that are usually green to reddish in color. Selliguea mairei is characterized by its small, often clustered sporophytes, which are borne on short stalks. This species is often found in montane regions and is adapted to cool, moist conditions.
